intro: Fleischmannia yungasensis, commonly known as the Yungas fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Yungas region of Bolivia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often covered with fine hairs. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its ecological niche.
